name: LifeWorks Employment Program (LWP)
description: LifeWorks Employment Program is a youth workforce development program for high school youth designed to provide early exposure to college/career pathways and vocational opportunities, prepare youth to enter the labor market, and support their academic needs. Services include life skills and job readiness training, academic and personal goal setting, college-readiness/preparation, tutoring/homework support, work-based learning opportunities such as job shadowing, and wage-based work experiences.
fullDescription: LifeWorks Employment Program is a youth workforce development program for high school youth designed to provide early exposure to college/career pathways and vocational opportunities, prepare youth to enter the labor market, and support their academic needs. whatTheyOffer: LifeWorks Employment Program is a youth workforce development program for high school youth designed to provide early exposure to college/career pathways and vocational opportunities, prepare youth to enter the labor market, and support their academic needs. Services include life skills and job readiness training, academic and personal goal setting, college-readiness/preparation, tutoring/homework support, work-based learning opportunities such as job shadowing, and wage-based work experiences.
howToGetIt: Contact: Nancy Abdul-Shakur, Program Director (415) 487-6715 / nancy@horizons-sf.org To Apply: Online Application Eligibility - Resident of San Francisco - 14 to 24 years old at the start of the program - Enrolled (or willing to re-enroll) in Middle/High School or a GED Program (or recently completed) - On or recently released from Juvenile or Adult Probation in San Francisco - Legally eligible to work - Able to attend weekly workshops - LifeWorks Cohort: 14-17 year olds, Wednesdays 4:00 – 6:00pm - TAY Cohort: 18-24 year olds, Thursdays from 1:00 – 2:00pm
agency: Horizons Unlimited of San Francisco, Inc
